alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 11 at 1:38PM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOWFALL EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF THE BLACK HILLS THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY... .A potent storm system will bring heavy precipitation and strong winds to the region today through Friday. Precipitation will begin as rain tonight, with some thunderstorms possible. Colder air wrapping into the system will allow precipitation to change over to snow across the Black Hills late tonight into tomorrow morning. Accumulating snow is expected over much of the Black Hills tomorrow through Friday morning, particularly across higher elevations of the northern and central hills. Some snow will also be possible if rain changes to snow in the Black Hills foothills Thursday night. If this does occur, there may be light accumulations. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Locally higher amounts are possible in the highest elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday to 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
